description.narrative: Danida Innovation & Business Explorer (DIBE) offers financial support to Danish companies, including start-ups, that wish to investigate concrete business opportunities contributing to the achievement of the Sustainable Development Goals and the Paris agreement. Uganda has served as a pilot country for Fasterholt Maskinfabrik, as the landscape in Uganda is very hilly, Fasterholt Maskinfabrik has developed a new type of brake in order to make the irrigation trailers more suitable for the market. The project in Uganda has highlighted that the African markets is ready for the benefits of Danish technology and expertise to assist the region with developing better crop production, food safety and mitigating the consequences of climate change. The company is now in contact with African Lease & Trade Ltd. As well as Engsol Ltd. with the purpose of setting up a company in Uganda, which they hope to function as a hub for further expansion into the EAC market.

Fasterholt Maskinfabrik is interested in marketing and selling Danish designed climate smart irrigation machines to Uganda. With this business project, Fasterholt Maskinfabrik wished to provide access to modern irrigation technologies and water harvesting methods and help small, medium and largescale farmers to better adapt to climate change – adding value not only to the environmental field but also to food security.
